title: Moped name from 1954
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Autoped54_6534.jpg)
  
This is my main question, what font is this? Year 1954.  
You can see it live in [http://autopeden.se/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/NV-115-1954.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/autopeden.se/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/NV-115-1954.jpg)

Additional question:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logga_4508.jpg)
  
Same moped, but text on the frame.
author: WYA

comments.content:
Some similar fonts regarding your main inquiry:  
 **[Material Headline](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Optimo%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Material%20Headline%20-%20Regular&fid=a1fea2f5313f26803694a0961b4a1a2f&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=AUTOPED&wrap=2)** by Optimo [2006-2010]  
 **[Gold (UltraBlack)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=FontMesa%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Gold%20-%20UltraBlack&fid=e32056447584583d794f88231ac99820&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=AUTOPED&wrap=2)** by FontMesa [2011-2012]  
 **[Giza Seven Seven](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Font-Bureau%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Giza%20SevenSeven%20-%20Regular&fid=486c590e2c21eb55a34d241d31ccfc44&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=AUTOPED&wrap=2)** by Font Bureau [1994]  
 **[Untitled Wood Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=IntellectaDesign%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=UntitledWoodType%20-%20Regular&fid=81c5e9c327e23d1511c1689a1f199e37&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=AUTOPED&wrap=2)** by IntellectaDesign [2008]

...and some alternates you may like for the second sample:  
 **[Colombine Pro (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Colombine%20Pro%20-%20Bold&fid=6eba6f34c25c176ddf9e6ac05deeaa38&fsize=60&text=Autoped&wrap=2)** by Linotype [2006 - 2012]  
 **[Mirabel (Two)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=CanadaType%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Mirabel%20-%20Two%20Regular&fid=0dc49133de097e4f4a266387de690417&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=Autoped&wrap=2)** by CanadaType [2008]  
 **[Kari Wide Pro (Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Positype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Kari%20Wide%20Pro%20-%20Italic&fid=114ec915b8f79871872ba46bfcff4638&fsize=60&text=Autoped&wrap=2)** by Positype [2005]
They all look good, will have my wife to have a look (she´s a pro). Thanks! :-)

From an 1954 print ad for this product -- not as bold as the lettering on metal

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Autopeden_6698.jpg)
 Don

Right weight and general tone for the script logo  
Number Five Smooth

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NumberFiveSmoothAsAutoped_4096.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090054/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/")  
Don

Hi Don and fvilanakis,

In print ad's I think they hade some look-a-like-font. The Material Headline as oblique seems to be the closest so far.

Many thanks for your help!!
